sections.title: Section I
sections.directions: Each question or incomplete statement is followed by four suggested answers. Select the best answer in each case.

questions.question: During photosynthesis, light energy is converted to chemical energy and stored in the form of
A leaf was kept in darkness or 48 hours and then tested for starch. The result is that no starch was found to be present. This shows that the leaf
selectableOptions: requires carbon dioxide to make starch.

questions.question: The requirements for photosynthesis are
selectableOptions: Carbon dioxide, chlorophyll, oxygen and water.
Carbon dioxide, chlorophyll, oxygen and Light.
Carbon dioxide, chlorophyll, light and water.
questions.wordAnswer: Carbon dioxide, chlorophyll, light and water.

questions.question: The gas used by green plants for photosynthesis is
The gas released by green plants during photosynthesis is
The gas released during photosynthesis can be identified using
The following are adaptations of the leaf to photosynthesis except
selectableOptions: The leaf has a broad flat shape to offer a large surface area for the absorption of carbon dioxide and sunlight.
The leaf has chloroplast containing chlorophyll to trap sunlight.
The cuticle is opaque for maximum penetration of sunlight.
Numerous stomata on both surfaces of the leaf allow for exchange of carbon dioxide and oxygen with the atmosphere.
questions.wordAnswer: The cuticle is opaque for maximum penetration of sunlight.

sections.title: Section II
sections.directions: Each question or incomplete statement is followed by four suggested answers. Select the best answer in each case.

questions.question: The raw materials for photosynthesis are
The products of photosynthesis are
The energy needed for photosynthesis comes from
The following are true of photosynthesis except
Which of the following does NOT affect the rate of photosynthesis?
The role of chlorophyll is to
Which of the following chemicals could be added to water to help ensure that Elodea would photosynthesize?
In what form is the sugar produced during photosynthesis stored in green plants?
The site of photosynthesis in a cell of a green plant is
It adds oxygen to the atmosphere
The chemical used to test for starch is
Which of the following is autotrophic?
Palisade mesophyll cells release more oxygen than spongy mesophyll cells because
selectableOptions: Palisade mesophyll cells contain less chloroplasts than spongy mesophyll cells.
Palisade mesophyll cells receive less light than spongy mesophyll cells
Palisade mesophyll cells contain more chloroplasts than spongy mesophyll cells.
Palisade mesophyll cells are rectangular while spongy mesophyll cells are spherical
questions.wordAnswer: Palisade mesophyll cells contain more chloroplasts than spongy mesophyll cells.

sections.title: Section III
sections.directions:
Each question consists of three responses. 
One or more of the response(s) is or are correct. 
Select: 
A. If 1, 2 and 3 are all correct. 
B. If 1 and 2 only are correct. 
C. If 2 and 3 only are correct. 
D. If 1 only is correct.

questions.question: Types of autotrophic nutrition
Deficiency of nitrogen in plants will lead to
Photosynthetic cells in a leaf are
The glucose produced during photosynthesis can be
nonSelectableOptions: combined with nitrogen to form proteins
converted to cellulose for the formation of new cell walls

questions.question: The chloroplast of plant cells
nonSelectableOptions: Combine carbon dioxide and water to form glucose.
Maintain the shape of the cells.

sections.title: Section IV
sections.directions:
Each question consists of a First and Second statements. 
Choose: 
A. If both statements are true and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first. 
B. If both statements are true and the second statement is not a correct explanation of the first. 
C. If the first statement is true and the second statement is false. 
D. If the first statement is false and the second statement is true.

twoStatements: Photosynthesis takes place only during the day.
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first

twoStatements: Starch is a structural polysaccharide in plants.
Starch can be converted to sucrose and transported to storage organs
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: First statement is False. Second statement is True

twoStatements: The cuticle on the upper epidermis of a leaf is thicker than that on the lower epidermis.
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first

twoStatements: Glowing splint is used to test for oxygen produced during photosynthesis.
oxygen is a raw material in photosynthesis.
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: First statement is True. Second statement is False

twoStatements: Green plants manufacture their food using carbon dioxide and water.
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first

sections.title: Section V
sections.directions:
Each question consists of four lettered headings A, B, C and D. 
Select the heading which is closely related to the description.

questions.question: Storage polysaccharide in plants
Structural polysaccharide in plants
Color observed when iodine solution is dropped on boiled rice
Rekindles glowing splint
Non gaseous product of photosynthesis
Photosynthetic portion of a leaf
The main organ of photosynthesis
The Physical process which allows carbon dioxide to enter photosynthetic cells and oxygen to exit
Placing a potted plant in darkness for at least 48 hours before using it in an experiment
Waste product of photosynthesis

sections.title: Section VI
sections.directions: Each question or incomplete statement is followed by four suggested answers. Select the best answer in each case.

questions.question:
In an experiment to test a leaf for starch, one of the steps involved placing the leaf in boiling water for 30 seconds. 
Why was the leaf placed in boiling water for 30 seconds?
selectableOptions: To remove chlorophyll from the leaf
To stop starch grains from bursting

questions.question:
In an experiment to test a leaf for starch, one of the steps involved placing the leaf in a boiling tube about a third full of alcohol and heating in a water bath until the alcohol was just about to boil. 
Why was the leaf heated in alcohol?
selectableOptions: To make the leaf permeable to iodine.
To remove chlorophyll from the leaf.
questions.wordAnswer: To remove chlorophyll from the leaf.

questions.question: In an experiment to test a leaf for starch, the last step involved placing few drops of iodine unto the leaf. Which color indicates the presence of starch?

In an experiment to find out if carbon dioxide is necessary for photosynthesis, two experiments are usually carried out simultaneous. Before the start of the experiments, the two potted plants used were placed in darkness for at least 48 hours. 
Why were the potted plants placed in darkness for at least 48 hours?
selectableOptions: To allow enough time for photosynthesis to occur.
To destarch the leaves of the plants
To detach the leaves of the plants
questions.wordAnswer: To destarch the leaves of the plants

questions.question:
In an experiment to find out if carbon dioxide is necessary for photosynthesis, the pot containing the plant is placed in a polythene bag and tied around the plant's stem. 
What is the role of the polythene bag in this experiment?
selectableOptions: To stop light from reaching the soil in the pot.
To prevent water evaporating from the soil.
To prevent carbon dioxide released by respiring soil organisms from reaching the leaves.
To prevent soil organisms from escaping.
questions.wordAnswer: To prevent carbon dioxide released by respiring soil organisms from reaching the leaves.

questions.question:
In an experiment to find out if carbon dioxide is necessary for photosynthesis, two experiments labelled A and B were carried out simultaneous. Both experiments were similar in all aspects except in Experiment A, Caustic Soda solution was placed next to the potted plant in a bell jar while Caustic Soda was absent in Experiment B. 
What is the role of Caustic Soda?
selectableOptions: To absorb oxygen from the atmosphere within the bell jar.
To produce enough carbon dioxide for use by the leaves.
To absorb carbon dioxide from the atmosphere within then bell jar.
To produce oxygen for use by the plant in tissue respiration
questions.wordAnswer: To absorb carbon dioxide from the atmosphere within then bell jar.

questions.question: In an experiment to find out if carbon dioxide is necessary for photosynthesis, two experiments labelled A and B were carried out simultaneous. Caustic Soda solution was placed next to the potted plant in a bell jar in Experiment A while Caustic Soda was absent in Experiment B. At the end of the experiments, a leaf was detached from both potted plants and tested for starch. Which experiment will have leaves that show a positive test for starch?

In an experiment to find out if carbon dioxide is necessary for photosynthesis, two experiments labelled A and B were carried out simultaneous. Caustic Soda solution was placed next to the potted plant in a bell jar in Experiment A while Caustic Soda was absent in Experiment B. At the end of the experiments, a leaf was detached from both potted plants and tested for starch. Which experiment will have leaves that show a negative test for starch?
What chemical substance is tested for to show that photosynthesis has taken place in a leaf?
The effect of absence of light in plants include
